title.narrative: 8.1 POLICY, BUDGET, SOCIAL PROGRAMS

description.narrative: Output 8.1: By 2018, the technical services of social sector ministries have strengthened capacities to formulate gender- sensitive national plans and budgets aiming to reduce poverty as well as social programmes that promote equity and the rights of the child, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Economic And Social Policy General, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 8: By 2018, children, especially the most disadvantaged enjoy better recognition of their rights in national and local development policies, strategies and programmes as well as through allocations of public resources.

participating-org.narrative: DREP DOSSO DREP MINISTERE DE LENSEIGNEMENT PRIMAIRE

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 8.1: By 2018, the technical services of social sector ministries have strengthened capacities to formulate gender-sensitive national plans and budgets aiming to reduce poverty as well as social programmes that promote equity and the rights ofthe child

description.narrative: The policy environment for youth-inclusive, participatory policy-making improved with multisectoral governmental roadmap Words of Youth; aiming at promoting youth empowerment and entrepreneurship. Capacity for budget data transparency, long-term scenarios building and prospective planning and the shift to outcome-oriented budget programs help increase accountability, efficiency and equity of government&39;s budget. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

title.narrative: A regular consultative framework between the Ministry of Finance, line ministries, Parliament and civil society debates and provides recommandation on public expenditure monitoring, performance analysis and accountability in relation to the implementation of the national development plan (PDES)
Public expenditure analyses of social sectors produced annually are debated during the parliamentary budget sessions
Number of social sectors having elaborated their annual performance plans and reports as part of the West African Economic and Monetary Union (UEMOA) public finance reform.
1.2 National government measurement of child poverty using monetary measures
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of advocacy and engagement to place child poverty as a national priority
Governemnt budget allocations to sectoral or child-focused policies and programs as percentage of total government budget allocations
1.1 National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures
1.4 Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty

Information and reports on child-focused public expenditures (by sector and sub-sector) is available by governments; sectors are health, nutrition, child protection, social protection, WASH and education
